info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Upper Colonias, or 20 miles west of Las Vegas, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Upper Colonias, South San Ysidro, San Geronimo, North San Ysidro, Mineral Hill, San Pablo and Lower Colonias. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 312 and 315. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 3 and 12. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 6 and 12, and near Mile Marker 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
